intro: Persoonia mollis subsp. revoluta, commonly known as the silver-leafed geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and small, clustered white or cream flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. It is often found in heathlands and shrublands, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
